Message: Since you have nutrient-rich soil, CO2, and high density of fast plants, the plants will consume the ammonia spike immediately. Optimal path.
Inefficient. You have the hardware for immediate growth. Waiting 4 weeks wastes the initial soil nutrient spike that stems crave.
Redundant and Dangerous. Soil is already leaching ammonia. Dosing liquid ammonia on top will cause toxicity.
Slower. Since you have fast plants, waiting for the leeching phase without relying on plant uptake is slower than a Silent Cycle.
High Risk. Even with fast plants, Aquasoil ammonia spikes are unpredictable. Livestock may suffer burns.
Since you have high nutrients/light but slow/sparse plants, algae will dominate if you light the tank now. 4 weeks darkness prevents this.
Biomass Insufficient. Slow/sparse plants cannot metabolize the massive soil ammonia spike fast enough. Algae bloom guaranteed.
Valid ONLY if lights are dimmed. You must rely on water changes (not plants) to remove the leeching soil ammonia. High maintenance.
Missing Engine. Without CO2, plants cannot metabolize nutrients fast enough to keep up with Aquasoil leaching. Algae takeover.
Since you have high light potential but no CO2, a Dark Start allows the soil to off-gas ammonia safely before you risk turning on lights.
Valid ONLY if lights are dimmed. High light without CO2 triggers algae immediately in nutrient-rich water.
Energy Bottleneck. Basic lights often lack the PAR to drive the rapid photosynthesis required for a true Silent Cycle. Melt risk.
Optimal Low Tech. Soil leeches ammonia, low light prevents algae, water changes keep it safe. Slow and steady.
Safe bet. Allows soil to settle without any algae risk. Works perfectly for low tech.
Optimal. You control the ammonia fuel precisely via dosing. Start lights dimmed to protect slow growing plants.
Biologically Sound. Dosing liquid ammonia in the dark builds a strong bacterial colony with zero algae risk. Safe, but requires patience.
Impossible. Inert sand has no fuel (ammonia) to start the cycle. Slow plants cannot drive the cycle alone.
Starvation Risk. Fast plants on inert sand need Liquid Macros (NPK) immediately, not just ammonia dosing. High maintenance start.
Impossible. No soil ammonia to fuel the plants. They will melt within days.
Valid ONLY if lights are dimmed. Dosing ammonia into a high-light/No-CO2 tank guarantees Green Water algae.
Great strategy. Since you lack CO2 to fight algae, cycling in the dark allows you to establish bacteria safely before dealing with the light balance.
Optimal Low Tech. Dosing liquid ammonia is the standard, reliable method for inert substrates.
Cruelty Risk. Fishless dosing is equally effective and safer for livestock.
Energy Bottleneck. Basic lights + No CO2 + Sterile Sand cannot support high density fast plants. They will rot.
Missing Fuel. No Soil Leech, No Liquid Ammonia. You cannot cycle a tank with water and rocks.
Last Resort. Since substrate is sterile and you lack liquid ammonia, you are relying entirely on fish waste. High stress for animals.
Missing Fuel. You cannot do a Silent Cycle without Aquasoil.
